metadata.title: CVE-2018-19935 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
ext/imap/php_imap.c in PHP 5.x and 7.x before 7.3.0 allows remote attackersto cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and applicationcrash) via an empty string in the message argument to the imap_mailfunction.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19935` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.2 - 7.2.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libphp7.2-embed - 7.2.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
php7.2 - 7.2.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
php7.2-bcmath - 7.2.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1

criterions.comment: php7.2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.2.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
